stories.title: Apple’s new Private Relay is leaking your original address through WebRTC

stories.text:
I'm starting a monthly thread where people can find HN Threads they lost.

Often we lose Blogs/HN Threads because we forgot to bookmark them or for any other reason. You can post description about the threads here. Other people can try to help the author find the articles. Additionally, Since people forget most of the things they read but they still remember ( or are trying to remember) the posts mentioned here, the posts are bound to be very interesting.

Tips on what you can/should mention while trying to find a thread -

1. Add a vague Timeline when it was written/posted here. 2. If you remember anything about the author, mention it. 3. You can mention what kind of discussions happened in HN Threads of the topic. 4. Write whatever you remember about the blog.

I'm submitting the threads I want to find below as an example.
stories.title: Ask HN: Find Lost Blogs/HN Threads
Observability Isn't About Logs, Metrics, and Traces
Starlink's network faces significant limitations, analysts find
As China-Taiwan Tensions Rise, Japan Begins Preparing for Possible Conflict
GraphQL is a slightly better REST
